perturbation.original_text: Contribution by Sponsor: In consideration for the right to sponsor the Kaya Fest and to be acknowledged by Fruit of Life Productions LLC., as a Promoter of the event during the term of this Agreement, Sponsor agrees to contract with Fruit of Life Productions LLC., for the amount of $250,000.00 to be paid in full upon signing of this agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Contribution by Sponsor: In consideration for the right to sponsor the Kaya Fest and to be acknowledged by Fruit of Life Productions LLC., as a Promoter of the event during the term of this Agreement, Sponsor agrees to contract with Fruit of Life Productions LLC., for the amount of $250,000.00 to be paid within 90 days of signing this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original agreement requires full payment upon signing, while the modified version allows for payment within 90 days. Although seemingly more lenient, this contradicts the standard and legally sound practice of immediate payment for services, potentially creating ambiguity around fulfillment obligations if the service is provided before payment. It weakens the enforceability and clarity of the payment terms.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding payment terms and enforceability.

perturbation.original_text: Notice: All notices given under this Agreement shall be in writing, addressed to the parties at the addresses set forth below, and shall be deemed to have the duly given when delivered when sent by overnight courier, or certified mail (return receipt requested).
perturbation.changed_text: Notice: All notices given under this Agreement shall be in writing, addressed to the parties at the addresses set forth below, and shall be deemed to have been duly given when sent by standard mail.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause requires overnight courier or certified mail (return receipt requested), providing proof and a specific timeline for delivery. The modified clause only requires standard mail, which does not provide proof of delivery or a guaranteed timeframe. This contradicts standard legal practice, potentially leading to disputes over whether notice was properly given, especially concerning critical deadlines.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Standard legal practice regarding acceptable methods for providing legal notice.

perturbation.original_text: The term of this agreement will begin on April 1, 2018 and continue until April 30, 2018 at 11:59pm.
perturbation.changed_text: The term of this agreement will begin on April 1, 2018 and continue until March 1, 2018 at 11:59pm.
perturbation.explanation: This changes the end date of the agreement to occur before the start date of the agreement, which renders the agreement invalid from its inception. The agreement is no longer a valid contract and would not be enforceable under Florida law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Basic contract law regarding the term and validity of contracts.
